deleted_lines: import sqlalchemydef clone_table(name, parent, meta, newcols=None, ignorecols=None, swapcols=None, ignorecons=None): """Helper function that clones parent table schema onto new table. :param name: new table name :param parent: parent table to copy schema from :param newcols: names of new columns to be added :param ignorecols: names of columns to be ignored while cloning :param swapcols: alternative column schema :param ignorecons: names of constraints to be ignored :return: sqlalchemy.Table instance """ newcols = newcols or [] ignorecols = ignorecols or [] swapcols = swapcols or {} ignorecons = ignorecons or [] cols = [c.copy() for c in parent.columns if c.name not in ignorecols if c.name not in swapcols] cols.extend(swapcols.values()) cols.extend(newcols) new_table = sqlalchemy.Table(name, meta, *(cols)) def _is_ignorable(cons): # consider constraints on columns only if hasattr(cons, 'columns'): for col in ignorecols: if col in cons.columns: return True return False constraints = [c.copy(target_table=new_table) for c in parent.constraints if c.name not in ignorecons if not _is_ignorable(c)] for c in constraints: new_table.append_constraint(c) new_table.create() return new_table def migrate_data(migrate_engine, table, new_table, skip_columns=None): table_name = table.name list_of_rows = list(table.select().execute()) colnames = [c.name for c in table.columns] for row in list_of_rows: values = dict(zip(colnames, map(lambda colname: getattr(row, colname), colnames))) if skip_columns is not None: for column in skip_columns: del values[column] migrate_engine.execute(new_table.insert(values)) table.drop() new_table.rename(table_name)

commit_message:
Using 5.7.29 tag for mysql image.

mysql:5.7 image always links to the lastest mysql 5.7 image,
this may not be stable for our CI test.

Change-Id: I8845918929aeb3c35270be9148120a1f445e3fa9

commit_message:
FFWD3: Refactor system upgrade

Upgrade should use system_upgrade.yaml that provides Leapp options.
Undercloud should use upgrade run with --system-upgrade and the yaml
file. After this run user has to reboot it.

Introduce tag for Controlplane and Compute upgrades separately so we
can have different stages for them.

Cleanup unneeded code for Overcloud upgrade.

Note that all workaround scripts still use os_upgrade instead of
system_upgrade. The changing of the naming convention for the hooks
can be done in another patch.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>

Change-Id: I573e01b8ce3060f78af5daa61e25fbc428d19518

commit_message:
Fix instance table behavior after deleting an instance

After deleting a VM from the instances table,
all VMs above it in the table list disappear from the
UI until the page is refreshed.

Partial-Bug: #1859851

Change-Id: Icae04fd0f0c3f3fa5127309b64fc1b15e3bbc677
(cherry picked from commit c90c0b709c170fae299acc5917e7da69fb2ef2a8)

commit_message:
Fix ORM caching for with_for_update calls

The SQLAlchemy recommends to use populate_existing() when using
with_for_update() [0], it fixed issues with the caching of the objects.

This patch precisely fixes a bug when locking of a loadbalancer in the
batch member update API call, the load balancer might not have been
locked correctly and race conditions could have occurred (processing
simultaneously 2 requests in the workers for the same load balancer).

[0] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.Query.with_for_update

Story 2010646
Task 47642

Co-Authored-By: Gaudenz Steinlin <gaudenz.steinlin@cloudscale.ch>

Change-Id: Ibd4da09079e83789d6cfe3658fcf1f266f5cf8b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/14/877414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixed a potential race condition in the member batch update API call, the load balancers might not have been locked properly.

subject: Support --os-key option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-10 23:47:22.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1999775-add-os-key-0cfc95c7b480df05.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient/commit/e2a4886d7f7e1fc14d44775d662c48fed94e78a0', 'message': 'Support --os-key option

keystoneclient Session expects as cert argument, one of the followings:
 * None (no client certificate),
 * a path to client certificate,
 * a tuple with client certificate/key paths.

The change updates manilaclient code to support the last case (ie:
os_cert and os_key are non-empty) with the --os-key option
and OS_KEY environment variable.

commit_message:
Support --os-key option

keystoneclient Session expects as cert argument, one of the followings:
 * None (no client certificate),
 * a path to client certificate,
 * a tuple with client certificate/key paths.

The change updates manilaclient code to support the last case (ie:
os_cert and os_key are non-empty) with the --os-key option
and OS_KEY environment variable.

Closes-Bug: #1999775
Change-Id: I09313b7c55a5f9d4ec032a37e69a1d79db29d648
(cherry picked from commit 43943fdf670328e2fe606c07949190e9e45063ae)
(cherry picked from commit 8d9ea26f56b82044aa74fab669225df47143068e)
(cherry picked from commit 7acf31c62b5b66899aef6c76800c2088d130da7a)

commit_message:
Fix pre-wallaby branches: force an older tempest env

Since Id02221df0d6180519751c63e890851bd59fdafa0, in order to fix
lp#2004780, the job which all jobs defined here inherit from
uses the 'integrated-full' tox environment, which doesn't exist
on older branches. Those should use the 'full' tox environment
instead.

As this devstack plugin is not branched, as long as there are
jobs which use it on older branches, we should make sure
to not break them.

This broke a few other jobs, so use those fixes as examples:
(see I5f1c4de0e7ec0cc6d7f6ba7d7aa78aabc931d23e )

Related-Bug: #2007986
Change-Id: Iec4f5adc5bebb811e1ef44208a98d7403d1e8c01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-nfs refs/changes/12/878912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Retire now-outdated snapshot spec

Snapshot support is expected to come via the newly designed Service
Steps, which is providing a generic framework for performing actions on
ACTIVE Ironic nodes -- including snapshotting.

Ironic contributors will write a new spec about implementing snapshot
via Service Steps once that work is completed.

Story: 2008033
Task: 40689
Change-Id: I288c77eba746c855c0bc9b9fd89ae557cbfddd7a

commit_message:
Backport fixes

This patch contains the following changes squashed into a single commit,
because each change individually doesn't produce a working build:

- 71bc319 Use unittest.mock instead of mock
- d3f30c4 Fix unittest
- Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Related-Bug: #2012108
Related-Bug: #2002788

commit_message:
Reset member provisioning status to NO_MONITOR when a HM is deleted

At present, when a health monitor (HM) is created for a pool,
the members of that pool are automatically set to ONLINE
provisioning status, unless the HM identifies an ERROR during
health checks.

This patch addresses an issue where, after deleting an HM,
the members should be reset to NO_MONITOR provisioning status,
regardless of whether the HM had previously set them to ONLINE
or ERROR status.

Closes-Bug: #2007985
Change-Id: I02bcba61d0cbc9202a6e50b849f8d781fb825d49
(cherry picked from commit 569c9c011a2cc9e5f041633dde4a47257e4d8565)

commit_message:
Add a Note Under Install and configure Section in documentation

This patch adds a note to use keystone port 5000 while configuring
horizon for all distros like ubuntu/debian/rdo/obs under the install
and configure section. Right now if a user tries to set up an OpenStack
env. manually using documentation [1], [2] leads to some confusion
because keystone documents suggest creating keystone endpoint at
http://controller:5000/v3/ rather than http://controller/v3/ while
horizon document consider keystone doesn't run at 5000 port updated
by [3].

Closes-Bug: #1910476
Closes-Bug: #1926096
Closes-Bug: #1950919
Closes-Bug: #1956437
Closes-Bug: #1892279
Closes-Bug: #1903320
Change-Id: I18d0d2105ea54ba02f8979ab7a15a75a0425b8c7

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/install/keystone-install-ubuntu.html#install-and-configure-components
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/install/install-ubuntu.html#install-and-configure-components
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/697406

Change-Id: I537a963c9d955b8d7e21f0d05b0197588907419e
(cherry picked from commit 029de21c1190bb9d2e38063b62c689c1dbb8ef37)

commit_message:
Fix rescue of volume-based instances

Rescue of volume-based instances is supported since Nova
microversion 2.87.
However, Horizon does not use this microversion when requesting
rescue of any instances, causing a Nova exception for volume-
based ones.

The patch fixes this by explicitly setting the required
microversion.

Closes-Bug: #1941744
Signed-off-by: Jan Hartkopf <jhartkopf@inovex.de>
Change-Id: Ic0cdfd326475882f839fd218cd7b4bfa62a2a76b
(cherry picked from commit 05dd53a3cf3e1ced265d23d1c02765abd468a483)
(cherry picked from commit 761e466e7a0628ae939dd654152f615732ad4f79)
(cherry picked from commit 1cd150cdc568e81eb2ead8819d5559cf3e23a296)

commit_message:
ovn: allow returning metadata packets for stateless security groups

With stateless SGs, we can no longer rely on conntrack to allow
returning traffic from metadata service. Instead, we should explicitly
enable the flow via ACL.

This patch creates OVN ACLs for metadata packets (tcp port = 80, src ip
= 169.254.169.254) when the corresponding SG is stateless. It will also
remove the ACLs when SG is switched back to stateful. It will also
utilize the new external_ids:neutron:revision_number key to monitor for
db inconsistencies between neutron and ovn databases.

Closes-Bug: #2009053
Change-Id: Ia1313730789f3deb58218477b65d02126a228810
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/876659/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(ihrachys): Remove the migration after the first SLURP release after # Bobcat. @periodics.periodic(spacing=10, run_immediately=True) def create_service_traffic_acls_for_stateless_sgs(self): # Only the worker holding a valid lock within OVSDB will perform the # migration. if not self.has_lock: return admin_context = n_context.get_admin_context() nb_sync = ovn_db_sync.OvnNbSynchronizer( self._ovn_client._plugin, self._nb_idl, self._ovn_client._sb_idl, None, None) nb_sync.create_service_traffic_acls_for_stateless_sgs(admin_context) raise periodics.NeverAgain() # The migration will run just once per neutron-server instance. If the lock # is held by some other neutron-server instance in the cloud, we'll attempt # to perform the migration every 10 seconds until completed.

commit_message:
mypy: Fix implicit optional usage

Current versions of mypy run with no-implicit-optional
by default.  This change gets Nova's mypy test environment
to pass again.

Change-Id: Ie50c8d364ad9c339355cc138b560ec4df14fe307

subject: [dhcp] Add DHCP domain_name option from network properties
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-29 09:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/25a4e2bab63b278951a4e4d76d550818f5ed24c2', 'message': '[dhcp] Add DHCP domain_name option from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. (Not a bug fix, but extend functionality)
! This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP domain_name option).

EXPLANATION.
At current moment DHCP option domain_name can only be set statically
via CONF-file (dns_domain option in neutron.conf), so all instances in all
projects/networks will receive it without respect dns_domain network
property.
This patch make availability to setup domain_name DHCP option from
network dns_domain property if it exist and no static dns_domain option set via
config file

Change-Id: I4ea7a7e02b82297cddba25cbd524eca7fee9330f
'}]
commit_message:
[dhcp] Add DHCP domain_name option from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. (Not a bug fix, but extend functionality)
! This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP domain_name option).

EXPLANATION.
At current moment DHCP option domain_name can only be set statically
via CONF-file (dns_domain option in neutron.conf), so all instances in all
projects/networks will receive it without respect dns_domain network
property.
This patch make availability to setup domain_name DHCP option from
network dns_domain property if it exist and no static dns_domain option set via
config file

Change-Id: I4ea7a7e02b82297cddba25cbd524eca7fee9330f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/878820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif self.network.dns_domain: cmd.append('--domain=%s' % self.network.dns_domain)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If36a55450610d991f19de8a790fb5eec70d69db7

commit_message:
Add neutron_ovn_availability_zones parameter

With the new ``neutron_ovn_availability_zones`` parameter it is possible
to define network availability zones for OVN. Further details can be found
in the Neutron OVN documentation:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/ovn/availability_zones.html#how-to-configure-it

Change-Id: I203e0d400a3218d0b4a41f2a948207032c4febec

commit_message:
Pin openvswitch package on RHEL-likes to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 due to
missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24)

Related-Bug: #2013189
Change-Id: I918248169e5b4c12ba968c8157576628830c5eb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/24/878924/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add skip_os_tempest conditional for dataplane adoption jobs

The var is set by [1] which depends-on this patch. This will allow
us to skip tempest in dataplane adoption jobs. This also removes
the redundant conditional for EOL releases p/q/s.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdo-jobs/+/47955

Change-Id: I5a8e46e94b51a6c81214673b41c1db1ad16971c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/19/878519/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if job.skip_os_tempest is defined and job.skip_os_tempest | default(false) | bool -%} false {%- elif release not in ['pike', 'queens', 'stein'] -%}

commit_message:
multi-rhel images prepare default

New arguments:
 --enable-multi-rhel : flag to create multi-rhel prepare
 --excludes: list of containers to include/exclude
 --minor-override: tags to override on the minor release
 --major-override: tags to override on the mayor release
 --role: list of the roles
 --role-file: role_data.yaml patch

Example:

[stack@standalone ~]$ openstack tripleo container image prepare default \
 --enable-multi-rhel --excludes nova-compute \
 --excludes nova-libvirt   --excludes ovn-controller \
 --major-override "{'tag':'other_tag'}" \
 --minor-override "{'tag':'my_tag'}"  --role ComputeEL8

    - nova-compute

      ceph_alertmanager_tag: v0.23.0
      ceph_grafana_image: ceph-grafana

added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--enable-multi-rhel', dest='multi_rhel', action='store_true', default=False, help=_('Use this flag to enable multi-rhel') ) parser.add_argument( '--exclude-include', dest='services', action='append', default=[], help=_('List of services to include/exclude') ) parser.add_argument( '--tag', dest='tag', action='store', default='', help=_('The tag for the different version') ) parser.add_argument( '--roles', dest='roles', action='append', default=['ComputeEL8'], help=_('List of roles') ) if parsed_args.multi_rhel: cip_exc = copy.deepcopy(cip) cip_inc = copy.deepcopy(cip) if len(parsed_args.services) > 0: cip_exc[0]['excludes'] = copy.deepcopy(parsed_args.services) cip_inc[0]['includes'] = copy.deepcopy(parsed_args.services) if parsed_args.tag != '': cip_inc[0]['set']['tag'] = parsed_args.tag base_role = [cip_exc[0], cip_inc[0]] for role in parsed_args.roles: params[('{}ContainerImagePrepare').format(role)] = base_role

commit_message:
Add support for HAProxy L7 checks

This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks (which continue to be the default). It also enables /healthcheck
endpoint for cinder-api on openstack releases >= ocata.

Closes-Bug: #1880610
Change-Id: I9d118f70fc1390be7b800ad20ae20e77818adac7

commit_message:
Add support for HAProxy L7 checks

This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks.

Closes-Bug: #1880610
Change-Id: I4a947c5b52eb3283c08a0d39cc9bf14695a63eab

commit_message:
remove unused tripleo-common dep form nova-scheduler.

Previously tripleo-common was installed in nova-scheduler container so
that the additional scheduler filter for baremetal porisioning can be
used. However nova was already removed from undercloud and the library
is no longer used since wallaby.

Also the package pulls the transitive deps and removing it reduces
the container size significantly.

Change-Id: Icae34a6d3f6e9b2c5a02b3bf52eabba1712ec922
(cherry picked from commit 64aaa5cef1fa8cea0d39626c4834a787db214a59)
(cherry picked from commit faab92a88ebdbdf1e6528de764a4210f6ea0d646)

commit_message:
Show Network QoS rules one per line

The command "network show qos policy <qos>" now shows the QoS rules
printed one per line.

Example: https://paste.opendev.org/show/bgam6amfLUVheAMhDxB3/
Change-Id: I65a99da16056902a822804e29b2dd9376a72e091

commit_message:
Set cinder public_endpoint option

This ensures we use the correct pagination link URL when using HTTPS:

prior to this change I was seeing the following tempest failure:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_list.py", line 366, in test_volume_list_details_pagination
    self._test_pagination('volumes', ids=self.volume_id_list, detail=True)
  File "tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_list.py", line 336, in _test_pagination
    self.assertEqual(next, response.response['content-location'])
  File "/home/stackhpc/.rally/verification/verifier-7cc15436-5efd-43f3-ba5d-91f049165e4d/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 411, in assertEqual
    self.assertThat(observed, matcher, message)
  File "/home/stackhpc/.rally/verification/verifier-7cc15436-5efd-43f3-ba5d-91f049165e4d/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 498, in assertThat
    raise mismatch_error
testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: !=:
reference = u'http://headinthe.cloud:8776/v3/157120e89e8742e5aab770e5000715dd/volumes/detail?limit=1&marker=4cc3b803-ad04-426d-89ac-5c872f2e7667'
actual    = 'https://headinthe.cloud:8776/v3/157120e89e8742e5aab770e5000715dd/volumes/detail?limit=1&marker=4cc3b803-ad04-426d-89ac-5c872f2e7667'

Where I have enabled SSL.

Change-Id: I1b27ee69759739afcfae00349f66621d7f2c7252
Closes-Bug: 2013184

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dash-separated config

Resolve the following warnings like the following being issued when
building the package:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I4b75aac2c09b772f91e5ac9a4e77e9462f38bfd1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add 'SizeColumn' formatter

Present file sizes in human readable format.

Change-Id: I7e4a013cba7f91e38ba496d3ba7c4a67c4cd81c5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

added_lines: class SizeColumn(columns.FormattableColumn): """Format column for file size content""" def human_readable(self): return utils.format_size(self._value)

commit_message:
[CI] Test Neutron with IPv6 networks

Make sure to actually test IPv6 connectivity to our test instance in the
IPv6 jobs.

Change-Id: I7845448804e191af356e82f8ad33c563ffd8ebd5

commit_message:
Support ldap anonymous binding

We can support this simply by allowing ldap-user and ldap-password
configuration options to be optional.

Closes-Bug: #1762587

Co-authored-by: Vern Hart <vern.hart@canonical.com>

Change-Id: I2668d90a58aac9d103240dc67061612358a67150
(cherry picked from commit cb7fdb3527eda513554a521e8b594d36c168be3b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-ldap refs/changes/30/878830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
remove unused tripleo-common dep form nova-scheduler.

Previously tripleo-common was installed in nova-scheduler container so
that the additional scheduler filter for baremetal porisioning can be
used. However nova was already removed from undercloud and the library
is no longer used since wallaby.

Also the package pulls the transitive deps and removing it reduces
the container size significantly.

Change-Id: Icae34a6d3f6e9b2c5a02b3bf52eabba1712ec922
(cherry picked from commit 64aaa5cef1fa8cea0d39626c4834a787db214a59)

commit_message:
[Quality Assurance] Transition Xena to EM

This transition the stable/xena branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch after the transition.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is April 20th, 2023.

Change-Id: I81293ebf710e2a7a0bc3e7c5018ea9ab67fbffce

commit_message:
Fix delete image tests.

Add wait until checkbox is in active state.

Fix edit_image_description_and_name test.
Add wait until the name text box is filled by default name (is not empty).
In the other case selenium write new name into text box faster than default
name is written there so default name then rewrite the new name.

Change-Id: I56803e19dd80180cc432ca872a28a7ee7f41290d
(cherry picked from commit I56803e19dd80180cc432ca872a28a7ee7f41290d)
(cherry picked from commit 25c107d710a03024243463be7e1d8404f1375232)

added_lines: _resource_page_header_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'hz-resource-panel hz-page-header h1') _default_form_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'div.modal-dialog') _search_field_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'magic-search.form-control input.search-input') _search_button_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'hz-magic-search-bar span.fa-search') _search_option_locator = (by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, 'magic-search.form-control span.search-entry') _search_name_locator_filled = ( by.By.XPATH, "//*[@id='imageForm-name'][contains(@class,'ng-not-empty')]" ) _search_checkbox_loaded = ( by.By.CSS_SELECTOR, "td .themable-checkbox [type='checkbox'] + label[for*='Zactive']" ) def wizard_getter(self): return self._get_element(*self._default_form_locator) def _get_row_with_image_name(self, name): self.wait_until_element_is_visible(self._search_checkbox_loaded) return self.images_table.get_row(IMAGES_TABLE_NAME_COLUMN, name) self.wait_till_spinner_disappears() def delete_images(self, images_names): for image_name in images_names: self._get_row_with_image_name(image_name).mark() confirm_delete_images_form = self.images_table.delete_image() confirm_delete_images_form.submit() self.wait_till_spinner_disappears() def edit_image(self, name, new_name=None, description=None, min_disk=None, min_ram=None, visibility=None, protected=None): row = self._get_row_with_image_name(name) confirm_edit_images_form = self.images_table.edit_image(row) self.wait_until_element_is_visible(self._search_name_locator_filled) if new_name is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.name.text = new_name if description is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.description.text = description if min_disk is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.min_disk.value = min_disk if min_ram is not None: confirm_edit_images_form.min_ram.value = min_ram if visibility is not None: if visibility is True: confirm_edit_images_form.visibility.pick('Shared') elif visibility is False: confirm_edit_images_form.visibility.pick('Private') if protected is not None: if protected is True: confirm_edit_images_form.protected.pick('Yes') elif protected is False: confirm_edit_images_form.protected.pick('No') confirm_edit_images_form.submit() def delete_image_via_row_action(self, name): row = self._get_row_with_image_name(name) delete_image_form = self.images_table.delete_image_via_row_action(row) delete_image_form.submit()

commit_message:
Add functional tests for add/update security service feature

This patch adds functional tests positives and negatives
for the new APIs methods `manila share-network-security
-service-update` and `manila share-network-reset-state`.
Also, we added and fixed tests related to
`manila share-network-security-service-add`.

Partially Implements: bp add-security-service-in-use-share-networks
Change-Id: I8c1b882f9c4fe40a14d50a4ebb7a40ff5c94bb46
Signed-off-by: Andre Beltrami <debeltrami@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin refs/changes/34/775034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from manila_tempest_tests.common import constants from manila_tempest_tests.common import waitersfrom manila_tempest_tests import utils @decorators.idempotent_id('e71fb1dc-f6f8-49be-af7b-2c767a05503a') @tc.attr(base.TAG_POSITIVE, base.TAG_API_WITH_BACKEND) @utils.skip_if_microversion_not_supported("2.61") def test_share_network_reset_state(self): share_network = self.create_share_network( client=self.shares_v2_client, add_security_services=False) for state in (constants.STATUS_NETWORK_ACTIVE, constants.STATUS_NETWORK_ERROR, constants.STATUS_NETWORK_CHANGE): # leave it in a new state self.admin_shares_v2_client.share_network_reset_state( share_network['id'], status=state) waiters.wait_for_share_network_status( self.admin_shares_v2_client, share_network['id'], status=state)

The API reference did not mention the 501 status code which provider drivers
may return if they do not implement a feature or option.

Change-Id: Ic6f5cdf61edca130b874e940ba19637965d50f2e
'}]
commit_message:
Update the api-ref for 501 status codes

The API reference did not mention the 501 status code which provider drivers
may return if they do not implement a feature or option.
This patch updates the API reference to discuss the 501 status code.

Change-Id: Ic6f5cdf61edca130b874e940ba19637965d50f2e

commit_message:
Add note about removing leading tabs in ceph.conf files

As reported in bug #1914814, common ways to generate ceph config files
result in files that have leading tabs. These tabs make Kolla Ansible's
ini parser unhappy, so add a note to remind users to remove them.

Closes-Bug: #1914814
Change-Id: I4b06eae75bf238f2f093bfb76ba37c7f75dfd616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/57/878557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: Commands like ``ceph config generate-minimal-conf`` generate configuration files that have leading tabs. These tabs break Kolla Ansible's ini parser. Be sure to remove the leading tabs from your ``ceph.conf`` files when copying them in the below sections.

commit_message:
Remove unused identity options from tempest.conf

tempest does not support credential options such as username in
the identity section and these should be put into the auth section
instead.

Change-Id: I41d1994d7ac432233ebdc7bec8bd0a4c30ac7475

commit_message:
FFWD3: Refactor system upgrade

Upgrade should use system_upgrade.yaml that provides Leapp options.
Undercloud should use upgrade run with --system-upgrade and the yaml
file. After this run user has to reboot it.

Introduce tag for Controlplane and Compute upgrades separatel so we
can have different stages for them.

Cleanup unneeded code for Overcloud upgrade.

Change-Id: I573e01b8ce3060f78af5daa61e25fbc428d19518

commit_message:
WIP Enabling tempest sec service conf in devstack plugin

Due to a zuul v3 limitation it`s necessary setup the security
services MultiOpt in the manila devstack plugin. The idea of this
patch is enabling those configurations for the Dummy and Container
drivers.

Depends-On: I8c1b882f9c4fe40a14d50a4ebb7a40ff5c94bb46
Change-Id: Id8381f3ec11c5f745ef95c7a936863a08ffa962d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/89/775289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Option to setup the security service MultiOpt tempest configuration during # the devstack installation in the dummy and container driver with dhss-true MANILA_TEMPEST_SETUP_SEC_SERVICES=${MANILA_TEMPEST_SETUP_SEC_SERVICES:=False}

commit_message:
ci: MacvtapAgentTestCase.test_get_all_devices

The test was flake as it seems it was some time using mac of the veth1
or veth2. I plugged both and ensured that get all devices are finding
them.

Closes-Bug: #2013045
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com>
Change-Id: I93e388c066afad970b1c1fa43f98ff7ddff83761

commit_message:
[dhcp] Add DHCP dns_domain option from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP dns_domain option)

Change-Id: I736dbad6fdb68c9221b309af4bafce780ae0a9fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/878812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif network['dns_domain']: LOG.debug("Set DHCP domain_name option %s for subnet %s from %s network", network['dns_domain'], subnet['id'], network['id']) options['domain_name'] = '"%s"' % network['dns_domain']

commit_message:
[dhcp] Add dhcp option dns_domain from network properties

When network dns-domain option is set, add it to DHCP domain_name
option. This patch does not break default behavior when dns_domain
statically set up in CONF-file. But it extend functionality (dynamic
per-network DHCP dns_domain option)

Change-Id: I6fec0808e90a7ee7dc74434758d2468e737448cd

added_lines: @property def cluster_remote_public_addrs(self) -> Iterator[str]: """Retrieve remote addresses bound to remote endpoint. :returns: addresses bound to remote endpoints. :rtype: Iterator[str] """ return self._remote_addrs("public-bound-address") def db_public_nb_connection_strs(self) -> Iterator[str]: """Provide OVN Northbound OVSDB connection strings. :returns: OVN Northbound OVSDB connection strings. :rtpye: Iterator[str] """ return self.db_connection_strs( self.cluster_remote_public_addrs, self.db_nb_port ) @property def db_public_sb_connection_strs(self) -> Iterator[str]: """Provide OVN Southbound OVSDB connection strings. :returns: OVN Southbound OVSDB connection strings. :rtpye: Iterator[str] """ return self.db_connection_strs( self.cluster_remote_public_addrs, self.db_sb_port ) @property def cluster_public_addr(self) -> ipaddress.IPv4Address: """Retrieve local address bound to endpoint. :returns: IPv4 or IPv6 address bound to endpoint :rtype: str """ addresses = self._endpoint_public_bound_addresses() if len(addresses) > 1: logger.debug("Found multiple public ingress addresses, picking first one") address = addresses[0] elif len(addresses) == 1: address = addresses[0] else: logger.debug("Found no public ingress addresses") address = None return address @property def _endpoint_public_bound_addresses(self) -> ipaddress.IPv4Address: """Retrieve local address bound to endpoint. :returns: IPv4 or IPv6 address bound to endpoint """ addresses = [] for relation in self.charm.model.relations.get(self.relation_name, []): binding = self.charm.model.get_binding(relation) addresses.extend(binding.network.ingress_addresses) return list(set(addresses)) "public-bound-address": str(self.cluster_public_addr), "db_public_sb_connection_strs": self.db_public_sb_connection_strs, "db_public_nb_connection_strs": self.db_public_nb_connection_strs,

commit_message:
Add support for HAProxy L7 checks

This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks (which continue to be the default). It also enables /healthcheck
endpoint for neutron-api.

Closes-Bug: #1880610

Change-Id: Ia820d8c2ca709d6b358b1c80d770624568d9a85b

Makes my life easier wrt testing.

Change-Id: I5a79494eb81622be5e56686a1995eb2f0bddb085

commit_message:
Wait until SSHABLE for volume (de/at)tachment tests

Our qemu encryption test failed once with a volume detach timeout. We
suspect this to be caused by bug 1960346. Continue the work from [1]
by making that test wait for its instance to be SSHABLE before doing
anything else.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:wait_until_sshable_pingable+status:merged

Related-bug: 1960346
Change-Id: I1b360816d1ef143492eb827aada262553506061b

commit_message:
Fix mis-called function

In the rewrite from classic to operator, this function
was moved from a charmhelpers function to an apt lib
function and the signature should hve changed but did
not. This aligns with the correct method signature.

Change-Id: I8d0a82e979d3a9486191b0809dda139823a827d0

commit_message:
Fix pool creation with single LB create call

So far, creating a populated LB (or an LB tree) with non attached pools,
left the pools on PENDING_CREATE provisioning_state.

This patch adds the option of marking non attached pools to be active on
the MarkLBActiveInDB task.

Story 2010426
Task 46823

Change-Id: Ie5fb25e292461baca38499091e8f9b9a53e3ddcd

commit_message:
Support --os-key option

keystoneclient Session expects as cert argument, one of the followings:
 * None (no client certificate),
 * a path to client certificate,
 * a tuple with client certificate/key paths.

The change updates manilaclient code to support the last case (ie:
os_cert and os_key are non-empty) with the --os-key option
and OS_KEY environment variable.

Closes-Bug: #1999775
Change-Id: I09313b7c55a5f9d4ec032a37e69a1d79db29d648
(cherry picked from commit 43943fdf670328e2fe606c07949190e9e45063ae)
(cherry picked from commit 8d9ea26f56b82044aa74fab669225df47143068e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/21/877021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Support --os-key option and OS_KEY environment variable which allows to provide client cert and its private key separately.

commit_message:
Update block-storage-overview to reflect multiattach

According to https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/volume-multiattach.html,single volume can be attached to multiple
instances simultaneously in active/active or active/standby scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #2004419
Change-Id: Iaa941ce8c730ceb518c0425196191bec0623c75b
Signed-off-by: Ajay Pal <ajay.pal.bisherwal@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/44/877544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Prior to the Queens release, the Block Storage service did not provide a shared storage solution like NFS and you could attach a device to only one instance. However, with the introduction of Cinder multiattach, you can now attach a single volume to multiple instances simultaneously in active/active or active/passive scenarios.
deleted_lines: The Block Storage service does not provide a shared storage solution like NFS. With the Block Storage service, you can attach a device to only one instance.

subject: Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-24 15:51:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-2003455-dff0d0f00b5a18e2.yaml', 'neutron/common/ovn/constants.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2ab2c922b11a7d7c55d7120d83532c3ad45d6255', 'message': 'Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit 786d89fee0dca2914a0fce2dc39761c55c917f81.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: Id1992d47a70f940d932390a662b7961783a57710
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit 786d89fee0dca2914a0fce2dc39761c55c917f81.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: Id1992d47a70f940d932390a662b7961783a57710

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
tox 4 compatibility

Remove 'usedevelop = true' and 'skipsdist = true', the combination of
which now means we don't install dependencies. Also remove the
basepython setting, which is no longer needed since we don't have any
Python 2-first distros to worry about. Finally, remove the
lower-constraints job and we no longer test for these.

Change-Id: I5b4b8cc1facb6e18cf12d33ea8113d47a0a76235
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 12900da15b3163ac46504c9658f83e81b6849d82)

commit_message:
Revert "Nit: Change from dict to object notation"

This reverts commit feec91cec10ff080f124cfbb8ff7274bfb25ba8b. Turns out
this wasn't okay, sub_ports property on Trunk objects is a list of
dictionaries.

This also fixes unit tests to account for that.

Change-Id: I17f217a6f2bfc833019ba407c248564e74b663d2

subject: formatters: Cast *all* columns before outputting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-12-20 11:19:36.000000000', 'files': ['osc_lib/tests/cli/test_format_columns.py', 'osc_lib/cli/format_columns.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib/commit/1deaaecc09377b6f034693bf7c3045f0c304cd4b', 'message': 'formatters: Cast *all* columns before outputting

This is a continuation of a previous change, change
Ib7db6a25f2352a013cb2ce603e60ca48b6cc70e6 ("formatters: Cast columns
before outputting"). As noted in that change, libraries can return
non-primitive types for many operations which can break YAML output
formatting since PyYAML only works with primitive types in safe mode.
That change was not complete as it only handled the formatters for dicts
and lists, not dicts of lists or lists of dicts. Close this gap now.

While we're here, we improve test coverage and catch a number of bugs
with the existing tests.

Change-Id: Ifd8db5b725f46a1ca216986167a0bcde5aec1e16
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
formatters: Cast *all* columns before outputting

This is a continuation of a previous change, change
Ib7db6a25f2352a013cb2ce603e60ca48b6cc70e6 ("formatters: Cast columns
before outputting"). As noted in that change, libraries can return
non-primitive types for many operations which can break YAML output
formatting since PyYAML only works with primitive types in safe mode.
That change was not complete as it only handled the formatters for dicts
and lists, not dicts of lists or lists of dicts. Close this gap now.

While we're here, we improve test coverage and catch a number of bugs
with the existing tests.

Change-Id: Ifd8db5b725f46a1ca216986167a0bcde5aec1e16
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Read stack output to get AdminPassword

We are currently using environment API to obtain AdminPassword but
the API no longer shows the secret informations.
This updates the logic to use the stack output instead.

Conflicts:
	tripleo_common/tests/test_inventory.py

Closes-Bug: #2006125
Change-Id: I788f7b52cad8008e1a1fbd1329d51606cee262fe
(cherry picked from commit 010c9aeb56e245694baff302fe4119df32bf0c57)

commit_message:
Spliting centos scenario job into 2 jobs

The duration of the c9s scenario job is really close to the max timeout
in Zuul, spliting it into 2 jobs would reduce the duration of the tests
and would avoid possible timeouts.

Change-Id: I3b70171624e5c42fd6055d73a040704af5910944

commit_message:
Add support for the OVN Neutron Agent service

This patch adds support for the OVN Neutron Agent service [1].

This new agent will include any needed OVN functionality not
implemented in ovn-controller. This agent will, in a future, include
the metadata service, superseding the OVN Metadata Agent.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/868076

Related-Bug: #2000385
Related-Bug: #1998608
Change-Id: I14a3868d991fbbb3472e29a7796aa61e8d225b98

TrivialFix

subject: Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-24 15:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-2003455-dff0d0f00b5a18e2.yaml', 'neutron/common/ovn/constants.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ba7d18d6346f051de24a2e928ad66fcadca49874', 'message': 'Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit a415bb4c98fa0a7b30f36cf9d2811576181fadf5.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: I9daa7fcc0c1edc9c3d162228153be187dea8ae52
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit a415bb4c98fa0a7b30f36cf9d2811576181fadf5.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: I9daa7fcc0c1edc9c3d162228153be187dea8ae52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/43/878443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2023.1

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2023.1.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2023.1.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I2261e0c0c7b4f1f818f41d02782dcfa1284233af

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle testing runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Moving the py36 job to py38 based as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.
Also indicates that we support python 3.9.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: I219c1f16d2654dcb40b345a340975060f58ddbae

commit_message:
utils: Remove unnecessary attribute check

The 'get_osc_show_columns_for_sdk_resource' method was checking for the
presence of an 'allow_get' attribute on the provided SDK resource. This
seems to have been used as a sentinel to determine whether the provided
resource was an instance of 'openstack.resource.Resource' or not.
However, the 'allow_get' attribute is deprecated for removal and no one
should be passing anything else to this method.

Remove the check and correct the docstring to better indicate what kind
of object we expect.

Change-Id: Ib39cae4895aef3297b48ef9ff0d13ada6b7b586e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/36/813236/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: columns if getattr(sdk_resource, 'allow_get', None) is not None: resource_dict = sdk_resource.to_dict( body=True, headers=False, ignore_none=False) else: resource_dict = sdk_resource

commit_message:
Don't display Munch objects in the output

When the SDK gives us a resource that contains Munch columns, drop them
from the output as they are for programmatic usage only and have no use
in a CLI context.

Copied from change Idd7306cd763b5a017a66e410e70e1adb02663c2a, which made
the equivalent change to OSC function this is based on.

Change-Id: I203d82eebbfea279f6750c533167b765deda5202
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>

commit_message:
Check auth_url as well as identity version api

When check the identity api version whether we should drop domain
information from configuration or not, we should check auth_url as well.
Otherwise the user can not get authenticated if the user use the
keystone api v3 for authentication without specifying identity api
version by command option or environment variable. Because the default
identity api version in configuration is currently configuread as v2.0.

Change-Id: Ib90fc937fb018b9c9dd96c7d87f8ddb7c6c52f0b
Closes-Bug: #1737069

commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I631fb791ece68aac607aeae56ce96a0d472964c8
(cherry picked from commit 32742e784ac31b8ebb8af9bb71a366c71c47c31c)

commit_message:
Add option to replace `shell.prompt_for_password`

Having the password for openstackclient in the shell environment seems
bad from a security perspective and using randomly generated passwords
is hard, when the user has to to type/retrieve them everytime.

Therefore, this commit adds a new parameter `--os-pw-func` to the shell,
which accepts a callable to import and call instead of
`osc_lib.shell.prompt_for_password`. This makes it possible for users to
implement their own password-retrieval methods e.g. from a password
manager.

Change-Id: Iaa93f6c129eb0bda83d36918c58ee89cfef89e17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/33/609433/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--os-pw-func', metavar='<pw_func>', dest='pw_func', help=_('Retrieve the OS_PASSWORD with the callable supplied as ' ' a dotted path. For an example look at' ' osc_lib.shell.prompt_for_password.') ) # Import custom password-retrieval-function or set default if self.options.pw_func is None: self.options.pw_func = prompt_for_password else: pw_func = importutils.import_class(self.options.pw_func) self.options.pw_func = pw_func pw_func=self.options.pw_func, pw_func=self.options.pw_func,

commit_message:
Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit 15053cae8461a8314249d3bc667f5bcaadb7994e.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: I5e1ccfea76f56ce876b20a93684464dee57dcf5a

commit_message:
Make sure socket listens on specific interface

This change makes sure that systemd sockets for libvirt/virtproxy
listen on a specific interface instead of all interfaces, when user
gives the listen_address parameter.

Closes-Bug: #2012747
Change-Id: I8e7775ce73eeb44a60dc94de1c1707aec92f6ae3

subject: Remove redundant hard-coded default of ssl_only
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-18 07:24:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_init_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/fcaac38dcda440d8badb705db3e1f95fbba7f9d2', 'message': "Remove redundant hard-coded default of ssl_only

This option defaults to false in nova, thus we don't have to define
the static default in our module.

Change-Id: Ia70a11adc6bd42503ede0dcb316bb5a0757dbfd7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant hard-coded default of ssl_only

This option defaults to false in nova, thus we don't have to define
the static default in our module.

Change-Id: Ia70a11adc6bd42503ede0dcb316bb5a0757dbfd7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/50/877850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_expected.to contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/ssl_only').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>')

commit_message:
libvirt: Drop unused listen options

The following options are no longer used since we replaced --listen
argument by systemd unit files.
 - listen_tcp
 - listen_tls
 - listen_addr

See [1] to find more details.

[1] https://libvirt.org/daemons.html#monolithic-systemd-integration

Related-Bug: #2012747
Change-Id: If63ae17ad2df79f8a91bc2db5c21939c36f12e02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/42/878542/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_libvirtd_config('listen_tls').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_libvirtd_config('listen_tcp').with_value('1') } it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tls').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tcp').with_value('1') } context 'with listen_address set' do let :params do { :listen_address => "127.0.0.1" } end it { is_expected.to contain_libvirtd_config('listen_addr').with_value('127.0.0.1').with_quote(true) } end context 'with listen_address set and modular_libvirt set to true' do let :params do { :listen_address => "127.0.0.1", :modular_libvirt => true, } end it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_addr').with_value('127.0.0.1').with_quote(true) } end it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tls').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tcp').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_libvirtd_config('listen_tls').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_libvirtd_config('listen_tcp').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tls').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tcp').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_libvirtd_config('listen_tls').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_libvirtd_config('listen_tcp').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tls').with_value('0') } it { is_expected.to contain_virtproxyd_config('listen_tcp').with_value('0') }

commit_message:
[doc] Add sample dummy driver config

This should help new contributors have an easier
on-ramp to certain kinds of manila development.

Change-Id: I55a43cccec2f8a1987042398c9f8057a95f44d8f
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/72/878272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ################################################################# # This local.conf sets up Devstack with manila enabling the Dummy # driver which operates in driver_handles_share_services=False # and driver_handles_share_services=True modes via four distinct # backends. It's important to remember that this driver does # not provision real storage. ################################################################# [[local|localrc]] ADMIN_PASSWORD=secret DATABASE_PASSWORD=$ADMIN_PASSWORD RABBIT_PASSWORD=$ADMIN_PASSWORD SERVICE_PASSWORD=$ADMIN_PASSWORD DEST=/opt/stack DATA_DIR=/opt/stack/data LOGFILE=/opt/stack/devstacklog.txt # Enabling manila services LIBS_FROM_GIT=python-manilaclient enable_plugin manila https://opendev.org/openstack/manila enable_plugin manila-ui https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui enable_plugin manila-tempest-plugin https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin # Dummy Backends config options SHARE_DRIVER=manila.tests.share.drivers.dummy.DummyDriver MANILA_CONFIGURE_GROUPS=buenosaires,saopaulo,lima,bogota,membernet,adminnet MANILA_CONFIGURE_DEFAULT_TYPES=true MANILA_SERVICE_IMAGE_ENABLED=false MANILA_SHARE_MIGRATION_PERIOD_TASK_INTERVAL=1 MANILA_SERVER_MIGRATION_PERIOD_TASK_INTERVAL=10 MANILA_REPLICA_STATE_UPDATE_INTERVAL=10 MANILA_DEFAULT_SHARE_TYPE_EXTRA_SPECS='snapshot_support=True create_share_from_snapshot_support=True revert_to_snapshot_support=True mount_snapshot_support=True' MANILA_ENABLED_BACKENDS=buenosaires,saopaulo,lima,bogota MANILA_OPTGROUP_buenosaires_driver_handles_share_servers=false MANILA_OPTGROUP_buenosaires_replication_domain=DUMMY_DOMAIN MANILA_OPTGROUP_buenosaires_share_backend_name=ALPHA MANILA_OPTGROUP_buenosaires_share_driver=manila.tests.share.drivers.dummy.DummyDriver MANILA_OPTGROUP_saopaulo_driver_handles_share_servers=false MANILA_OPTGROUP_saopaulo_replication_domain=DUMMY_DOMAIN MANILA_OPTGROUP_saopaulo_share_backend_name=BETA MANILA_OPTGROUP_saopaulo_share_driver=manila.tests.share.drivers.dummy.DummyDriver MANILA_OPTGROUP_lima_driver_handles_share_servers=true MANILA_OPTGROUP_lima_network_config_group=membernet MANILA_OPTGROUP_lima_share_backend_name=GAMMA MANILA_OPTGROUP_lima_share_driver=manila.tests.share.drivers.dummy.DummyDriver MANILA_OPTGROUP_lima_admin_network_config_group=membernet MANILA_OPTGROUP_bogota_share_driver=manila.tests.share.drivers.dummy.DummyDriver MANILA_OPTGROUP_bogota_driver_handles_share_servers=False MANILA_OPTGROUP_bogota_share_backend_name=DELTA MANILA_OPTGROUP_bogota_replication_domain=DUMMY_DOMAIN MANILA_OPTGROUP_membernet_network_api_class=manila.network.standalone_network_plugin.StandaloneNetworkPlugin MANILA_OPTGROUP_membernet_network_plugin_ipv4_enabled=true MANILA_OPTGROUP_membernet_standalone_network_plugin_allowed_ip_ranges=10.0.0.10-10.0.0.209 MANILA_OPTGROUP_membernet_standalone_network_plugin_gateway=10.0.0.1 MANILA_OPTGROUP_membernet_standalone_network_plugin_mask=24 MANILA_OPTGROUP_membernet_standalone_network_plugin_network_type=vlan MANILA_OPTGROUP_membernet_standalone_network_plugin_segmentation_id=1010 MANILA_OPTGROUP_adminnet_network_api_class=manila.network.standalone_network_plugin.StandaloneNetworkPlugin MANILA_OPTGROUP_adminnet_standalone_network_plugin_gateway=11.0.0.1 MANILA_OPTGROUP_adminnet_standalone_network_plugin_mask=24 MANILA_OPTGROUP_adminnet_standalone_network_plugin_network_type=vlan MANILA_OPTGROUP_adminnet_standalone_network_plugin_segmentation_id=1011 MANILA_OPTGROUP_adminnet_standalone_network_plugin_allowed_ip_ranges=11.0.0.10-11.0.0.19,11.0.0.30-11.0.0.39,11.0.0.50-11.0.0.199 MANILA_OPTGROUP_adminnet_network_plugin_ipv4_enabled=True

subject: [Stateless SG] Test if TCP packets with various conn state are allowed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-10 16:06:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/commit/df3bf5e1d33ccb0514deb251ac5a7a75147567b3', 'message': '[Stateless SG] Test if TCP packets with various conn state are allowed

In stateless SG there is no connection track so TCP packet of any type
should be allowed by SG. This patch adds test which spawns 2 vms,
connected to 2 different networks and the same router. Both vms are
using different stateless SGs. Finally test asserts that packets of any
of the TCP type (syn, ack, syn-ack, psh, rst, fin) sent from one of the
vms can reach second one.

Change-Id: I23a4b282c83101526af05aa309d578aecaef1fa9

commit_message:
[Stateless SG] Test if TCP packets with various conn state are allowed

In stateless SG there is no connection track so TCP packet of any type
should be allowed by SG. This patch adds test which spawns 2 vms,
connected to 2 different networks and the same router. Both vms are
using different stateless SGs. Finally test asserts that packets of any
of the TCP type (syn, ack, syn-ack, psh, rst, fin) sent from one of the
vms can reach second one.

Change-Id: I23a4b282c83101526af05aa309d578aecaef1fa9

commit_message:
[Stateless SG] Ensure replies won't work without ingress rule

This patch extends existing
test_connectivity_between_vms_using_different_sec_groups
in the way that for stateless SG rules it makes sure that replies from
server to client will not work without explicity add SG rule which will
allow ingress traffic on the ephemeral ports' range.

Change-Id: I940678c15b65552634096ea3e72888b5bf830912

commit_message:
[Stateless SG] Add test to check connectivity between vms

This patch adds new test (for both stateful and stateless type of
security groups) which creates: 2 VMs connected to 2 different networks
and using 2 different SGs. Both networks connected to the same router.
Finally it checks TCP connectivity between VMs.
In case of stateless SG additional security group rule needs to be added
to allow ingress traffic on the ephemeral ports' range.

Change-Id: Icf318d8e7a76286ee2c2b8626d80e554aa5289f6

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I656137636f56ad700288c5a9556196c1a6930cac

commit_message:
Removing brackets around tested conditional

While permissible syntactically, using brackets to wrap tested conditional is unnecessary
and potentially confusing. As without inserted whitspace the code may look as a function
call, rather than a statement and expression.

The construct is also considered erroneous by linters.

Closes-Bug: 1983593

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0a086a8349e2a72cae024857e148fddc3556c319
(cherry picked from commit 56b700afcab95080182687f945c62cc96f650e45)

commit_message:
Fix share network create command with the AZ option

Previously, "share network create" command was trying to look up
the availability-zone provided by the user. However, this is not supported
by the AvailabilityZoneManager.

Drop the AZ lookup if the option is used and pass the user provided value
to the API.

Closes-Bug: 1962288
Change-Id: I3ec926122eed932caebcb31b9afd0f811f1f3c8e
(cherry picked from commit 1e379145023484e50bf60e57bb257dcd1fe53da5)
(cherry picked from commit 2128ea1729a512336cab6e323b210b646dec6489)
(cherry picked from commit 08b11ade05e179818ca228e281397bd369849d57)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/12/878012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace reference to deprecated [service_available] aodh_plugin

This option was deprecated in favor of the new aodh option. However
the old name is still used by code which causes the following warning
message.

WARNING oslo_config.cfg [-] Config option service_available.aodh_plugin
is deprecated. Use option service_available.aodh instead.

Change-Id: If10cec87a2f07f9dbe09005bb22070ca7a6e9364

commit_message:
Revert "Ensure vlan network traffic is not centralized"

This reverts commit 8e3bddbf8bc5296143357d3df7fd27aeb9bb9bd9.

Reason for revert:
As part of the reverted commit, the redirect-type=bridged flag was
enabled by default. However this have the side effect of also
decentralizing N/S traffic for geneve tenant networks, breaking the
VM connectivity on them when it must be centralized, i.e., when no
FIPs are associated to the VMs.

A new fix will be provided ASAP.

Change-Id: I30b1328b30f1b36b8b7ee556aa52ac6b2dd91d4e

commit_message:
Added alias for userdata.

This patch adds alias for userdata. If we are passing
userdata to the module then it breaks on the error:
`TypeError: fun() got an unexpected keyword argument 'user_data'`

Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id6ea9050984860fb0a27ba04a55203a394077c35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/45/878645/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: userdata=dict(aliases=['user_data']),

subject: Allow fluentd to read Open vSwitch log files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-02 09:52:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/37cdaa127519395aa845f3acbd98e82b8405d21b', 'message': 'Allow fluentd to read Open vSwitch log files

Open vSwitch log files (/var/log/kolla/openvswitch/ovsdb-server.log and
/var/log/kolla/openvswitch/ovs-vswitchd.log) are not readable by
fluentd.

This was seen while adding a check in CI for readability of these files
via the following command:

$ docker exec -it fluentd bash
find /var/log/kolla/ -type f | while read f; do test -r $f || echo
"Cannot read $f"; done

Generally there are a few ways in which access is provided to log file
for fluentd:

1. Set log file ownership to $USER:kolla, permissions to 0640.
2. Set log file ownership to $USER:$USER, permissions to 0644.
3. MariaDB is a special case, and uses 0640 with the fluentd user added
to the mysql group.

Of these, 1. seems the most secure, and this is the approach taken in
this solution.

Change-Id: Ia62fa061f65b2b5f9de814b2d976582051cde348
Closes-Bug: #1795609

commit_message:
Allow fluentd to read Open vSwitch log files

Open vSwitch log files (/var/log/kolla/openvswitch/ovsdb-server.log and
/var/log/kolla/openvswitch/ovs-vswitchd.log) are not readable by
fluentd.

This was seen while adding a check in CI for readability of these files
via the following command:

$ docker exec -it fluentd bash
find /var/log/kolla/ -type f | while read f; do test -r $f || echo
"Cannot read $f"; done

Generally there are a few ways in which access is provided to log file
for fluentd:

1. Set log file ownership to $USER:kolla, permissions to 0640.
2. Set log file ownership to $USER:$USER, permissions to 0644.
3. MariaDB is a special case, and uses 0640 with the fluentd user added
to the mysql group.

Of these, 1. seems the most secure, and this is the approach taken in
this solution.

Change-Id: Ia62fa061f65b2b5f9de814b2d976582051cde348
Closes-Bug: #1795609

commit_message:
Support qemu block rbd in nova-compute

This is necessary if using nova-compute with RBD backend (directly,
not via Cinder) and wishing to make an instance image to Glance
while (1) following the recommended Ceph permissions which do not
give Nova write permissions to the images' pool or (2) not using
RBD with Glance or (3) not revealing what Glance actually uses
as the backend (hiding locations).

Change-Id: I88e1e0ca01b2b2effad9515b905cc761fbb5d2d4
(cherry picked from commit 9e92e4c8e494ec345ccce1eff739f18bf9035c9b)

commit_message:
Read stack output to get AdminPassword

We are currently using environment API to obtain AdminPassword but
the API no longer shows the secret informations.
This updates the logic to use the stack output instead.

Closes-Bug: #2006125
Change-Id: I788f7b52cad8008e1a1fbd1329d51606cee262fe

commit_message:
fix(swift): allow object creation

It is currently not possible to create any new objects inside
Swift as you'd always get an error that the new object name
already exists all the time.

This fixes that issue and enables you to upload files again.

Closes-Bug: #1993005
Related-Change-Id: Idfb90a327e94ccaa3263aaaad1d6d52fa46312f4
Change-Id: Ib2f1aaae87820e8d5c4a6c9b01b6a6e9a5552952
(cherry picked from commit a327842a25f904397be0c3c141ada1f9ac8050cd)

commit_message:
Run validations with parameters from a file

This patch adds new command 'file'to the validation CLI. User can include and exclude validations by name(s), group(s), category(ies) or by product(s) and run them from YAML file with arbitrary parameters.

Resolves: rhbz#2122209

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-common/+/872746/
Signed-off-by: Veronika Fisarova <vfisarov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifc6c28003c4c2c5f3dd6198e650f9713a02dc82d

commit_message:
Skip stateless SG related tests for backends which don't support it

Currently stateless SGs are supported by ML2/OVN backend and by backends
which uses iptables based firewall driver.
It's not supported e.g. by ML2/OVS with 'openvswitch' fw driver thus
those tests should be skipped in case of that backend driver.

Change-Id: I9fa572c3b7eda96706caa2ba1a181de475357804

commit_message:
[WIP] Support deploying MariaDB for cells

Support deploying MariaDB clusters for use with Nova cells.
Cells are defined in the inventory, and per-cell settings
are provided via group_vars. MariaDB is placed behind HAProxy
and is accessible via an internal VIP address managed by
Keepalived.

NOTE:

For information on how this could be used please see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616645/

TODO:
* Release note
* Documentation on how to use

Partially Implements: blueprint support-nova-cells
Change-Id: I64cd62b42ed044f95ce50e5f60528cb2359169a6

added_lines: - name: Deploy mariadb with haproxy and keepalived on nova cells servers gather_facts: false hosts: - cells-mariadb tags: cells-mariadb roles: - { role: haproxy, haproxy_group: '{{ cell_haproxy_group_name }}', keepalived_virtual_router_id: '{{ cell_keepalived_virtual_router_id }}', role_kolla_internal_vip_address: "{{ cell_haproxy_internal_vip_address }}", haproxy_enable_external_vip: False, when: enable_cells | bool } - { role: mariadb, haproxy_group: 'cells-mariadb', role_kolla_internal_vip_address: "{{ cell_haproxy_internal_vip_address }}", mariadb_internal_fqdn: '{{ cell_haproxy_internal_vip_address }}', mariadb_group: '{{ cell_mariadb_group_name }}', mariadb_database_user: '{{ cell_mariadb_database_user | default(database_user) }}', mariadb_database_password: '{{ cell_mariadb_database_password | default(database_password) }}', role_mariadb_port: '{{ cell_mariadb_port | default(mariadb_port) }}', when: enable_cells | bool }

commit_message:
[WIP] Minimal support for deploying multiple instances of HAProxy

This change adds minimal support for deploying multiple
instances of HAProxy / Keepalived. It enables the internal VIP
address and the group name to be customised from group_vars. This
could be extended to support the customisation of other variables
such as the external VIP address in the future. Note that variables
which are not defined in group_vars/all.yml, or as extra vars can be
readily overridden and as such do not need to be changed. For
example: 'keepalived_virtual_router_id'.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-nova-cells
Change-Id: Iaf80815cff1cac9f0d42466b7cdd8e0d39020ce6

in horizon local_settings template.

commit_message:
Use follow: no when creating node_config_directory

For some reason this infinitely recurses when follow=yes (ansible 2.5
and above). Probably something on our end, but work around this
temporarily.

Change-Id: Ibf49e9fe067fba0da99c5c41cd6a5a821ef061f8

commit_message:
Add some sanity to nova_ssh allowed commands

Nova-ssh is used via the remotefs calls in nova.  This method implements
bascially 4 commands.  To limit the security risk of allowing
password-less ssh access between compute nodes for remotefs puproses we
should do sanity checking of the commands that are coming though ssh.

Prevent some un-needed ssh features from being allowed in with the
authorized key, as well as forcing only the remote_fs.sh shell script
to be ran.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649477
Change-Id: I05488a2a17d8773cb3944813f65cac40bc6f9595
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/79/649479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command="/usr/local/bin/remote_fs.sh",no-port-forwarding,no-X11-forwarding,no-agent-forwarding,no-pty {{ nova_ssh_key.public_key }}

commit_message:
Changed multinode file for host image destruction.
Commented line 'localhost ansible_connection=local' under '[deployment]'
for disabling the destruction of images on deployment host
when enable_destroy_images is set.

Change-Id: I00e6ca8137b60129ef456a7c9e1b69495563a220
Closes-Bug: #1724306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/57/647657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #localhost ansible_connection=local # you need to uncomment localhost when oprations specific to deployment node is needed. # Example: clean up images also on deployment node.

commit_message:
Add feature to merge_config to support extra_config

We need a method to change conf file withtout modify custome conf file.
Only need putting "{{service_name}}_extra_configs" param to host_vars or
group_vars. This will help us achieve without touching file to config
service param.

Change-Id: Ib61b10aa2cc23cbed4b886afcbed25bfe87c48f8

commit_message:
[WIP] Fast Forward Upgrade spec

This spec describe fast-forward upgrade procedure with
Kolla-ansible for an offline upgrade which effectively
runs the upgrade processes for all versions of openstack
components from your originating version to your desired
version.

Change-Id: I5417db363885e7a20fa81df7aa61eb70ce63e058
Partially-Implements: blueprint fast-forward-upgrades-support

This page will document how to enable or disable Fast-Forward-Upgrade. References ========== .. [1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Fast_forward_upgrades

commit_message:
Make policy target independent of new defaults

making available and working policy checks dependent on value of
enforce_new_defaults is counterintuitive, and forces operators
to re-write existing policies when switching to new defaults.

Closes-Bug: #2012513
Change-Id: I878ed0be24127dd3e1e377ec61bcf09d96fcbe20

commit_message:
Set internal and public endpoints for cloud creds

Advertise internal and public endpoints on the cloud credentials
relation. Two drive-by changes were also needed:

1) Add pkg-config package when building from cryptography
2) Update keystone to use v1 version of interface for cloud credentials

Change-Id: I50cb6592cdb003937ccf6ae0070437ed85bb753b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-k8s refs/changes/04/878704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LIBPATCH = 1 app_data["internal-endpoint"] = self.charm.internal_endpoint app_data["public-endpoint"] = self.charm.public_endpoint

commit_message:
Pin tox to < 4 for stable branch

ref. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-mysql-innodb-cluster/+/871369 and similar patches

Change-Id: I45507022f3382c4132a250a0484b12e4dbe363c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/06/878706/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTES: # * We avoid the new dependency resolver by pinning pip < 20.3, see # https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/9187 # * Pinning dependencies requires tox >= 3.2.0, see # https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-requires # * It is also necessary to pin virtualenv as a newer virtualenv would still # lead to fetching the latest pip in the func* tox targets, see # https://stackoverflow.com/a/38133283 requires = pip < 20.3 virtualenv < 20.0 setuptools < 50.0.0 tox < 4.0.0 # NOTE: https://wiki.canonical.com/engineering/OpenStack/InstallLatestToxOnOsci minversion = 3.18.0 charm-tools==2.8.4

commit_message:
Removing documentation of the deprecated and removed 'plan-environment.yaml'

Closes-Bug: #1995702

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib56110279b86c484be0f18ce9e4a6fc210d28af9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/40/863640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ================================= Samples for plan-environment.yaml ================================= The ``plan-environment.yaml`` file provides the details of playbooks and their parameters required for use cases like derived parameter workflow. It has a section ``playbook_parameters`` that is used to specify playbook name and playbooks parameters. These plan environment files can be provided as with ``-p`` option to the ``openstack overcloud deploy``. The sample format to provide the playbook specific parameters:: playbook_parameters: cli-derive-parameters.yaml: # DPDK Parameters num_phy_cores_per_numa_node_for_pmd: 2

commit_message:
Adding wsgi script to the gnocchi-api image

Move to the ansible managed httpd server requires addition of
a wsgi binary in order to replicate functionality previously provided by puppet managed server.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0c4f6fa885b1d9bd88405704bb0ab58a25594ac2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/59/859059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - run: mkdir -p /var/www/cgi-bin/gnocchi && cp -a /usr/bin/gnocchi-api-wsgi /var/www/cgi-bin/gnocchi/app

commit_message:
Converting gnocchi-api httpd configuration to ansible role

Ansible role will now be used for httpd setup on gnocchi-api containers.
The change directly affects gnocchi-api container and indirectly affects
other gnocchi, as well as ceilometer-upgrade containers.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/858878
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/859059

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9b291d96cc9cdc66dbe1d7076426d75750296ab0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/82/858882/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: type: ../../deployment/apache/apache-baremetal-ansible.yaml ApacheWSGI: true ApacheServiceName: gnocchi_api ansible_group_vars: get_attr: [ApacheServiceBase, role_data, ansible_group_vars] - gnocchi::api::manage_service: false - if: - source: "/var/lib/kolla/config_files/ansible/etc/httpd/conf.d" - source: "/var/lib/kolla/config_files/ansible/etc/httpd/conf" dest: "/etc/httpd/conf" - /var/lib/config-data/ansible-generated/gnocchi:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/ansible:ro - /var/lib/config-data/ansible-generated/gnocchi:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/ansible:ro - name: Configure vhost vars: gnocchi_api_network: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, GnocchiApiNetwork]} tripleo_httpd_vhost_ssl: {get_param: EnableInternalTLS} tripleo_httpd_vhost_servername: "{{ lookup('vars', 'fqdn_' ~ gnocchi_api_network ) }}" tripleo_httpd_vhost_bind_host: "{{ lookup('vars', gnocchi_api_network ~ '_ip') }}" include_role: name: tripleo_gnocchi tasks_from: api_httpd.yaml

commit_message:
tripleo_gnocchi service role

Derived from tripleo_aodh service role. Handles httpd configuration.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I32dc4fa9df2432ea377f5bfa0df4c9916d7ac2e6
